title: 2 Pence
description: The 2 pence coin is a large, copper-plated steel coin introduced in 1971. It’s widely recognized and frequently used in the UK.

messages.text: Hey there, big spender… didn’t expect me to talk, did you?
In the coppery flesh. Been around since 1971 — decimalisation day. I’m what you'd call “everyday royalty.” Pocket change to most, but I’ve seen things.

Vending machines, arcades, donation jars, lost between sofa cushions. I’m the coin of the people.

Oh and that is the Prince of Wales’s feathers on my back. 'Ich dien' — it means 'I serve'. Poetic, innit?
Do people still use you much?

Not like they used to. Some shops do not even accept me now. But I’ve got staying power.

I’m sentimental. Parents give me to kids. I get tossed in fountains for wishes.
To be more than just change. To remind people: even the smallest voice carries history.
Cool, thanks for sharing. I appreciate it
